column1: swing straight away. Leaves the right-hander from a fullish length and Masakadza presses forward and pushes it into the covers
full, angling in on middle and straightening from that channel, pushes it down to the ground with the full face of the bat. Neat shot to get off the mark
shortens his length right away. This one's at a back of a length and he tucks it with the angle to midwicket
full and angling on the pads, too easy for Masakadza who flicks uppishly past the fielder at short midwicket. Second four of the opening over
lovely, there's the riposte from the bowler. Full and drawing him forward. Masakadza responds and the ball  leaves him so late and so sharply to beat the outside edge
short of a length, left alone outside off
turn straightaway, takes the inside of the bat as Mire presses forward and defends
length ball, some turn and bounce, comes forward and works it to midwicket off the inside of the bat
length ball, spinning in, tucked to deep fine leg
pitched up outside off, flights it up with lots of room and Mire gets down and crunches a sweep from outside off through square leg
fullish length on middle, flicked to short leg
slightly back of a length, shifts back and pats it to the left of the short leg fielder for one
short of a length, holding its line outside off, left alone
short and wide, plays the upper cut. Not very convincing as he couldn't get on top of it entirely but enough to clear the in-field
short of a length, holding its line outside off, left alone
back of a length, angling in on middle and leg, flicked through midwicket
sticks his bat out to a wide delivery and gets beaten as the ball jags off the seam pretty late
full, angling in on off, driven to mid-off
loops it up on middle and leg, clipped through midwicket
flat and full outside off, just comes on with the arm and beats the edge as Mire sticks the bat out playing for the turn
huge appeal for leg before. Not given and it seems like the impact may have been outside off. Gets down to sweep to the wrong length. Not full enough. Mathews does not take the review
closes the face looking to flick with the turn but the ball's well outside off and he gets a leading edge into the off side
pitched up outside off, crunches a drive to mid-off
short of a length around off, stands tall and punches into the covers
presses forward to a length ball and gets a thick outside edge that gets past second slip diving to his right. Jags away late to undo him
short of a length on off, gets behind the line and punches down the ground solidly
the off-cutter outside off but too full and Mire picks it early. Waits for it before thumping it straight down the ground for four
short of a length, flicks uppishly with the angle through the vacant midwicket area
good length, cuts in off the seam to find the inside of the bat as he stands in the crease and punches
nearly holes out. Advances down the ground but is undone by the lack of sufficient flight. The bat handle turned in his hands and it goes one-bounce to deep midwicket
and now he skews one off the outside of the bat. Tries to come down the ground and go inside-out but skews it in the air off the splice over the cover region
too full and well outside off, gets down and crunches a reverse sweep through backward of point
full around off, jabs it towards mid-on for one
full and tight around off, defended off the front foot
short ball, bounces considerably and has him scampering under it. One for the over
short of good length on off, punched crisply off the backfoot back to the bowler
back of a length, a lot more width this time and Masakadza presses forward and punches into the covers
full around off, carved away to mid-on. No run there
short ball, this time it's not disconcerting for Masakadza who gets on top and controls a pull through backward of square leg
length ball on off, drops into the covers with a solid block off the front foot
flighted on middle and leg, these are easy offerings on the pads, and Mire gets down to sweep of them through backward square leg
now he advances down the ground and shovels it straight down the ground. Not as much flight this time but he uses his feet to get to the pitch
spinning in outside leg, tucked to square leg
fuller, clipped off the pads through square leg
again a leg-sidish line and he nudges it behind square leg for one
full on middle and leg, blocked to the right of the bowler
short of a length, presses forward and the ball jags away to find the outside edge before running down to third man
full and holding its line outside off, left alone
short of a length, nips into him and strikes the pad as it beats the attempted tuck. Angle an issue there. Would have missed leg
swing and a miss outside off
punched into the off side
full on middle and leg, flicked to midwicket
full and angling into the stumps, drilled to midwicket
short of a length, angling in, worked off the hips to deep fine leg
full on middle, turns it away with the angle to midwicket
short ball, gets well over the batsman and called a wide
angling in on the pads and that's easy pickings for Masakadza who picks it up off the pads and heaves it over backward square leg
full on the pads, clipped uppishly through midwicket
short ball, gets over off and Masakadza is looking for a wide call but the umpire deems it fine
short, angling down  the leg side, goes for the pull and misses
shortish and width on offer, reaches out and flat-bats it to point
good length, angling in on the stumps, worked to long-on
stays in the crease to defend and chops it into the surface
reaches out for a fuller delivery and drives it square, to the left of point who gets down and sticks the hand out. Good timing
too short and goes well over the batsman. This is some tripe from Perera. He's bowling all over the place
short of a length on off, defended
full and accurate around off, punched back
short of a length on off, turns it away into the leg side
short ball, rushes onto him at serious pace and beats the attempted pull

edged but safe. Extra bounce from around the good length region and completely catches him off guard. Mire can't get on top of it and gets an outside edge and goes on the bounce towards third man. Stayed up for a good length of time
short ball, this time he gets on top and crunches a pull to deep midwicket
good length, accurate on off, punched back
length ball around off, presses forward and eases a punch into the covers

stops on him a little. Could have been the slower ball as well. Looks to flick into the leg side and gets a leading edge as he closes the face early. Luckily for him, the ball lands on the vacant spaces at the cover region
fullish length at 124.2 ks, pats it into the leg side

oh, dear! This was a needless shot. He's been trying to force something for a while but it was really not required because Zimbabwe were moving along at a fair clip. Mire tries to force a pull but it really didn't come on to him. And it's the wrong line as well. Tucked up completely and he skews it off the top-edge to short midwicket who moves to his right and gets under it. Much-needed breakthrough for Sri Lanka and it's been gifted to them
brilliant fielding. Full and angling in on the pads, flicked off them and short fine leg dives to his left to stop a certain boundary
presses forward to a length ball and drops it into the covers
short ball, gets over middle and leg, ducked under
full on off, driven towards mid-off. A bit of hesitation on the single and Ervine eventually responds and beats the throw at the keeper's end
right move. Tries to slant it across and lure him forward but this was a tad too wide. Need to get it a little closer to make him play at it

edged and put down at second slip. Would have been a stunning catch had he held on. Kusal Mendis the fielder. Flung himself to his left and gets his hands on it but the ball bursts out. Poor shot from Ervine. Chasing a delivery he really should have left alone
full on off, defended
angling into leg-stump, turned away to deep backward square leg
back of a length, angled across, holds its line and it's left alone
short of a length on middle, quietly turns it away into the leg side
full and angled across on off, defended
short ball, angled across his off-stump and he sways out of the line to let it go
full and drifting into him, tries to flick but the ball grazes the pad instead as it goes to short fine leg
good length on off, defended off the front foot
short ball, shapes up for a pull but decides against it and keeps his bat down as the ball goes over
short of a length outside off, stands tall and punches to the right of deep point
short ball, uses the angle and just pulls it over the short fine leg fielder. Deep backward square leg runs across and dives to his right but the ball beats him
climbs from a good length region. Hits the high part of Masakadza's front pad
full delivery outside off, tidy line, defended into the cover region
nicely placed and timed into the gap at cover point for a couple. Just a push from Ervine

edged and taken at wide slip. Lakmal bangs it in, hits a hard length, and Ervine can't help himself from wafting. Gets a thick outside edge which flies to the well-placed slip fielder, who takes a sharp reverse-cupped catch. Extra bounce, pace and just enough lateral movement. Well bowled
good length on middle and leg, the ball coming back in slightly. Defended into the leg side
full delivery outside off, 136 kph, some seam movement back in. Edged into the pad
good end. Full delivery outside off, Taylor lifts his bat vertically and lets the ball go.
flat and quick, pushed through the air, defended back
very full outside off, sliced through to the sweeper cover for a run, hit with the spin
a tad short and wide, easy ball for Taylor to go  back and cut to deep cover to open his account
drilled through to deep cover. Overpitched and wide, smashed away with the spin
quick around off, flatter trajectory. Blocked back
looks for the reverse sweep, he likes that shot, but he toe-ends this away to point
good length delivery outside off, 136 kph, dabbed down to third man for a single.
good length delivery on middle, 129 kph, nudged down to fine leg
good batting from Masakadza. Taps a length delivery down to third man to get to fifty. Needs to double it or get close for Zimbabwe
127 kph, short delivery on off, well-directed, but there isn't a lot of pace on this surface. An awkward jabbed stab down to fine leg. Lobs away
on a length, 129 kph, worked away to midwicket
131 kph, back of a length delivery around off, Masakadza tries to drag his flick to midwicket but can only find the fielder
that's a filthy full toss. Happens with wristspin. Taylor heaves the ball away to the midwicket boundary. Nicely hit
83 kph, full delivery outside off, driven to cover
overpitched outside off, 84 kph, drilled to long-off for a single.
a yorker on middle and leg, 82 kph, driven to long-on. Too full
too full again, around off, jammed towards mid-on for one. Another good single
more flight outside off, nicely driven to long-off to get to the team 100
full delivery outside off, coming back in, driven to the sweeper cover
132 kph, full and straight, shovelled to square leg for nothing
another shortish delivery outside off, Taylor arches his back and carves the ball towards third man, on the bounce
back of a length, around off, defended back. A bit of extra bounce
full delivery, coming back in with the angle, pushed to mid-off
more extra bounce, 127 kph, around middle and leg, Masakadza keeps it out awkwardly. Seems to be generating some steep bounce from that good length area
85 kph, lots of flight, the offbreak maybe, worked to midwicket
gets right across and sweeps to short fine leg. Flat and straight delivery
looking for the paddle sweep this time, but it's too full, toe-ends it away

looking for the reverse sweep this time. He has been given, but Taylor reviews right away. Was there some bat or glove? He just missed a straight one, it seemed. But he did not, he got an under-edge onto the pad. Never easy for the umpire to see those ones, but good review from BT
flat and quick on middle and leg, 78 kph, nudged to midwicket
full delivery outside off, worked to deep square leg, got to the pitch
short and wide outside off, slapped away past mid-off for four. Too wide from Chameera, and there are massive vacant areas there. Nicely punched
back of a length around off, 133 kph, blocked back. Gets on top of the bounce
full delivery around off, a thick outside edge to third man. Nice lines
oops, dug in but too short and too wide. Masakadza swayed away, and earned an extra
back of a length outside off, punched away to cover from the crease. Stood tall and hit it away
short around off, worked away to midwicket
a tad too full outside off, driven to mid-off. Good comeback from Chameera in that over
knew his area, stayed low and slog-swept gleefully to the deep midwicket boundary. Better choice of sweep with that field. A tad too full from Dananjaya
beautiful batting, full delivery outside off, coming back in, worked away into the gap at square leg for two.
the googly, out the back of the hand, full delivery outside off, defended
full delivery outside off, 86 kph, nudged to midwicket
the legbreak this time, lots of flight down leg, spinning towards the stumps, defended
shuffles right across, gets outside the line, and looks to sweep, but misses. Struck outside the line. Good batting, gives yourself a failsafe if you miss
good length outside off, pushed to cover
this is so professional from these two. Waiting for the bowlers to err, this is slightly wide and Masakadza punches through extra cover for two. Well played
not in control, but he gets four. Dug in, short around off, Masakadza drags the pull from well outside off but bisects square leg and fine leg.
drifts down leg, wide.
beautifully played. Full and straight, Masakadza drills the drive right back, hits the stumps at the bowler's end
shortish and a tad wide, 134 kph, carved past the backward-backward point fielder for two.
good length down leg, nudged to fine leg for one
lots of flight around off, pushed away towards long-on
85 kph, the legbreak, on middle and off, driven to long-on
lovely batting. Lots of flight, Masakadza clears his front leg and nails the lofted drive right back from where it came. Great place to hit the ball, right over the umpire's head
nudged towards midwicket, beats the fielder, long-on runs around to clean up
flat around middle and leg, defended away
flat and wide, the legbreak, pushed to cover
slightly short and wide, smashed through extra cover for two. Great batting. Taking full advantage of poor bowling
too short again, and wide, slapped to long-on
well bowled, quicker through the air and a tad wide, pushed away towards cover
flight, and a tad wide, driven into the cover region
too short, lots of time for Taylor to pick the delivery off the pitch. He stays back and punches to the sweeper cover, to his right
on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
overpitched outside off, nudged to long-on for a run
lots of flight again outside off, driven to long-on

taken at mid-off. False shot, Masakadza is distraught. Lots of flight, overpitched outside off. Masakadza sees an opportunity, winds up and swings. But the ball is too full, disallowing him from getting underneath the length. And so his powerful drive goes straight to mid-off, who takes a juggled catch
loads of flight again, like an offbreak, driven to cover
flight outside off, 87 kph, sliced to the deep point fielder
down leg, nudged to fine leg
short and wide, a poor delivery to start. Taylor unleashes a cut but makes no contact
full and wide, 128 kph, left alone this time
full delivery outside off, fifth-stump channel, worked to midwicket
full and straight, shovelled to square leg. Playing with the full face
shortish delivery outside off, a dab to point
dug in, but drifts down leg for what I felt should have been a wide. Not called
eeks, that was tripe. A slow legcutter that was so short and soooo slow. Taylor was looking for the fine sweep but then improvised a paddle sweep to the fine leg boundary.
on the pads, worked away to deep midwicket for a single
a full toss outside off, Raza picks out midwicket as he looks to sweep
slower through the air, wider outside off, defended in front of point for a run
a low full toss on middle, pushed away to long-on
another neat drive to long-on for one
on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket with the angle
some seam movement back in, good length outside off, inside-edged into the body. Probing line
full and wide outside off, Raza looks to scythe a cut but misses
full delivery outside off, a thick outside edge past point. Third man runs around but two
good length down leg, worked towards square leg in the air. Lands just in front of the fielder
full delivery outside off, punched into the gap at cover for two. Very neat batting from these two
good length outside off, punched to cover from the crease
likes that shot too, short delivery around off, Taylor looks to ramp the ball towards third man but the ball lobs away off, and just past point
126 kph, short delivery outside off, left alone. Good line on the bouncer
good length outside off, 138 kph, punched to deep point
good length on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
dug in, short down leg, the ball flies down leg for an extra
on the pads, 134 kph, nudged to fine leg for a single.
length ball, keeps a little low outside off, manages to keep it out
strides forward to a length ball and crunches a punch through the covers
fullish length, angling into the pads at 129.6ks, flicked to midwicket
shot! Beautiful timing. Full outside off, it's a cross-seamer, he just strides forward, meets the pitch, and presents the full face to chip it over long-off
back of a length, tucked off the hips to deep fine leg

variable bounce. Taylor is cleaned up by one that keeps slightly low. But only slightly. It's a very good delivery. Cuts in off the seam and takes the inside edge as Taylor brings the bat out and clatters into the stumps. Crucial strike for Sri Lanka in their bid to peg Zimbabwe back
reverse sweep, put away through point. Susses out the length early and takes the front leg outside off before crunching it to the right of the fielder at point
full on the pads, turned away into the leg side
full on middle and off, spins in and takes the inside of the bat as he knocks it down to long-on
<the legbreak. Pitches on middle and comes on dead straight to hit the high part of his pad
gets the front leg out and that means he moves away from the line. But it's given him enough room for a clean flourish of the bat as he launches it over long-off
full on the pads, swept away to backward square leg
length ball outside off, opens the face and misses
short of a length, there's the variable bounce again, keeps a little low but he deals with it and defends
good length, nips in slightly and he turns it away with the angle into the leg side
short ball, Waller arches his back as the ball goes over middle and leg
full and angling on the pads, flicks it uppishly but manages to get it over the fielders at midwicket and mid-on. Dangerous shot
good length, just outside off, keeps it out with a solid front-foot defence
full and slid across on middle, pushed back
shuffles across to a length ball and flicks it to deep midwicket
waits for this length ball to spin into him before turning it away to deep backward square leg
fullish length, spinning in on middle, defended down the pitch
floated up around middle and leg, backs away and keeps it out awkwardly away from the body
beautiful shot. Advances down the track to meet the pitch before crunching an inside-out drive through extra cover
short of a length on off, punched away through the right of point
short of a length outside off, shuffles across and defends back
comes down the track and the bowler drags the length back. He adjusts well nevertheless and punches through the covers, to the right of the sweeper
short ball, completely loses shape as he pulls. The back hand comes off, his head tilts back and he almost tumbles over. Manages to keep it along the ground, though, so well done in the end
short ball, backs away and looks to ramp it over the keeper. Bounce is considerable and has him beaten

just wide of the fielder at deep square leg. Doesn't control this pull shot. This is a slower short ball, he had rolled his fingers over the seam, and Waller doesn't control the shot. Deep backward square leg runs to his left and dives but the ball lands just in front and sneaks past him
short of a length, backs away and looks to flick but inside-edges to the pad
fullish, spinning in on leg, shifts back and turns around as he whips it away to deep midwicket
loopy dipping fuller ball on off, sweeps with the turn to the fine leg region
short and spinning in, backs away and cuts through point. Brings up the 200 for Zimbabwe
drifting in on the pads, turns it away to short fine leg
extremely full on the stumps, dug out back to the bowler
shortish outside off, can't get on top of it as he drags a pull to mid-on
short again, sitting up more nicely for him this time and he swivels around with a pull to deep square leg
in the air and over mid-on. Waller is lucky. A scrambled-seam short ball outside off. He slaps it with a flat bat and it takes the top-edge and just lands in front of mid-on running back
short, sees the bounce on it and lets it go outside off
again just clears mid-on. This time it goes all the way to the boundary. This has got to be frustrating for Sri Lanka. Shortish again, no pace, this time he finds a smaller portion of the splice
short and too much bounce outside off
short of a length, cuts into him, backs away and opens the face to backward point
full and angling on leg, pushed down to long-on
short of a length, no pace at all, gently pulls it away to deep fine leg
full on middle and leg, 86.2 ks, pushed down to long-on
this one comes in to him slightly. Waller plays the line and the ball goes down to long-on off the inside of the bat
full, eased down to long-on off the front foot
slightly short, swivels through with a pull to deep backward square leg
leg-side line, backs away and turns it away to deep midwicket
slower short ball at 108ks, cut to sweeper cover
short ball, gets under it as the ball climbs over middle and leg
short of a length on off, stays legside of it and opens the face to point

in the air and in no man's land. Backs away to a shortish ball. All that does is tuck him up. And along with the lack of room, it results in a mistimed pull that goes in the air off the top-edge before landing in square leg. Midwicket gets around it
turned away to backward square leg
full outside off, driven to covers
shifts back to a length ball and pats it around the corner

appeal for lbw, not given. The angle seems very sharp but Sri Lanka are reviewing this. Cross-seamer, cuts in from a short of a length and beats his attempted whip to hit him in front of leg. But given the way it has drifted in, this seems unlikely to hit the stumps. Indeed, missing leg. SL lose their review
watchfully pushed it into the covers
full and tight on off, defended back to the bowler
short of a length, cuts in, waits before turning it away to short fine leg
short of a length. Sri Lanka's bowlers are offering no pace here. Jumps and slaps it past the left of the cover fielder to the sweeper
short of a length, jumps up and tucks it to deep backward square leg for one
short of a length, walks across off and looks to heave it over the keeper. Misses
short again, but the lack of pace is messing up their timing. Pulled in the air and one-bounce to deep square leg
slower short ball, gets up well over off
length ball, tries to tuck it away and the ball goes off the pad instead to square leg
well-bowled. Backs away and the bowler follows him with a dipping fuller ball that's been carved away to sweeper cover

oh, brilliant catch. That's as good a take as you'll ever see. Waller responds to a dipping full toss from outside off by getting down on one knee and heaving a sweep. Deep backward square leg runs to his left and slides across just in time to get behind the line and snaffle a lovely catch. And it's Tharanga with the terrific catch
chipped just over the bowler. A length ball, he strides forward to it and just checks a punch right over the bowler's head to mid-off
full outside off, driven down to long-off
sprayed down the leg side
backs away to give himself some room and knocks this to cover
ooh, what happened there? A length ball that cuts in like an off-break to hit him high on the front leg before lobbing away behind square on the off side
full and angling in on middle and leg, clipped wide of mid-on
full, around the fifth-stump channel, and it's a lovely stroke. Drives very late behind square on the off side by opening the face of his bat
fullish outside off, driven to point
length around off, defended back
length ball outside off, defended
short of a length in the corridor of uncertainty, holds its line and Moor sticks the bat out to get beaten
full outside off, leans forward and pushes it out to mid-off
good length, spinning in, swivels around and pulls it away through square leg. Fifty for Raza. He is key to their surge now
looped up on leg, hits the pad as it goes to short fine leg and they take on the fielder there for a leg bye
shortish, leg side line again, pulled out to deep square leg
legbreak, spins the other way from middle, pushed into the covers
again a legbreak, this one's shorter and he backs away before cutting crisply to sweeper cover

run out chance missed. He's confused by the spin on this one and gets hit on the pad as the ball lobs towards point. They steal a legbye and Dananjaya fails to collect the throw from Chandimal, who moved to his right, with the batsman a good distace away from the crease
poor delivery, drifts a back of a length delivery down the legside and it's tucked off the pads to deep fine leg
short ball, catches him off guard, gets up and arches his back but it climbs significantly to hit him on the arm
these are easy runs that are being gifted here. Again on the pads, back of a length, and it's been whipped off the pads through backward square leg
now he delivers one on off but the length is predictable. He isn't changing it up and Raza advances down, makes some room and slaps it through extra cover
takes off for a single after knocking this to point who has a shy at the stumps at the bowler's end and misses
in the air and safe! Moor looks to pull and gets a top-edge as he's tucked up. It lands in square leg with a man from the deep running in and midwicket running across. Lands in between both
that's a ridiculous shot. A slower back of a length ball, it's a legcutter, he picks it early and just slaps it straight over with a flat bat. Over long-on
fuller now, drilled straight to midwicket
Sri Lanka are not pleased with this call. It's the slower bouncer and it goes over the helmet and bat as Moor is crouching. Seems a fair call in the end

run out chance missed. Moor drills one straight back to perera who fields on the follow-through and hurls the ball with force towards the stumps. Raza was backing away. He needn't have gone so hard at it. Could he have even run to the stumps and taken off the bails? Anyway, they get a single in the end
very full outside off, fetches it from outside off and whips it through deep midwicket
full and wide, driven to cover who misfields. lets the ball go through and they take a brace
full on middle and leg, tries to heave it away and gets an inside edge to backward square leg
in the blockhole, angling in on leg, dug out into the off side
fuller, drilled between cover and mid-off
full toss, backs away and makes room and crunches a drive to the right of sweeper cover
another full toss, slips out of the hand and Raza slashes it out to third man. Very poor bowling
full outside off, stays put in the crease and swings away from his body and misses
short of a length, slower, pulled to deep midwicket
down the leg side, gets down for a heave and gets hit on the pad as the ball goes to short fine leg
that's been slapped straight over. A very wide fuller ball. Makes no effort to get close to it. Just stays in the crease and gets down on one knee before heaving it straight over

goes for the big hit again and this one's skewed off the splice. He's expecting it to come into him but it comes straight on and lobs in the air at cover where Dananjaya gets around it and takes it on the second attempt.

full and angling in on leg, he backs away but the ball follows him and he heaves it over mid-on. Gets lot of elevation but not the distance as the ball lands between the two fielders getting around it
extremely full outside off, crunches a drive to cover
wow, that kept very low. Flat and wide, and short. Keeps very low but Kusal slaps a drive past cover, wide long-off for four.
flat and wide outside off, too much width, Kusal goes back and carves a cut through backward point
some spin, but too wide again. Short and wide yet again, a thick outside edge over the slip fielder for a couple of runs. Got to bring that line sraighter
there it is, full on middle and leg, skewed to midwicket
on the pads, worked away to square leg
flat around off, punched to cover from the crease
waft from Kusal. Short delivery, angling away, Kusal goes at the ball but it leaves the bat hanging
a tad wider and Kusal slashes a punch through point. Back of a length delivery, just a scythe in the gap at point
that's what Jayasuriya used to do so effectively: pounce on even a little bit of width. Short and wide, he goes bottom to top and hits the ball over point for four.
shortish delivery, straight this time, nudged to deep square leg
poor line from Jarvis. Short down leg, nudged down to the fine leg boundary. Just a tickle and four. Zimbabwe have to adjust quickly
much better, good length, or just fuller than that. Angles away and beats the bat. Tharanga's bat left hanging. Good end
nicely bowled, quick outside off, defended
flight outside off, driven to cover
pushed through, overpitched and quick, driven past cover for a couple to wide long-off
76 kph, lots of flight on leg, driven to long-off
and again, quick outside off, scythed away towards point
flat outside off, 84 kph, outside-halved to third man
shortish delivery around off, Kusal is quick to pick up the length, but meets the ball too early, toe-ends it away
a slower delivery on the pads, nudged down to fine leg for a run
shot! 125 kph, shortish and wide, just a punch to point
edged but well short of wide slip. Full delivery, moving away, edged but dies in front
a tad short, a tad wide, Tharanga thinks there is a cut to play but the ball seams back in and goes past his shot
short down leg, nudged to short fine leg, an offcutter. But good comeback over from Jarvis
lovely from Kusal. A shimmy to the pitch, gets there and just chips the ball over long-on. Full face of the bat. Extended his shot
full on middle and leg, charges down and drives to long-off
74 kph, quick and flat around off, outside-halved to point

ooh, what happened there? A stumping missed? Or did the ball hit the stump, it did, it hit the leg stump with lots of force but it's a stubborn piece of equipment. Masakadza takes off the bail, weighs it and puts it back. Wow. Tharanga came down to the pitch and inside-halved the ball into his body, it ricocheted back but somehow Tharanga survives
what a shot, flight on off, Tharanga clears his front leg and lofts the ball easily over cover
poor delivery. Short and wide, slashed through extra cover for four. Was aware that Kusal may come down, but he didn't. The batsmen won that battle
more shots. Dug in, short and angling away, slapped through wide mid-on. Dragged it away. Big vacant areas
128 kph, full delivery on off, pushed to mid-off
127 kph, on a length around off, dabbed into the point region

and gone. Too many shots from Sri Lanka and they lose one. It's full outside off, he looks to flay a drive through the off side. Hard hands through the line, the ball lobs off the inside half to mid-on. A poor shot, it worked for a while but there were just too many, especially considering the start they had got
full around off, driven to mid-on
135 kph, a discernible change-up in pace. Shortish around off, fourth-stump channel, Kusal plays all around it and the ball goes through
full delivery, coming back in, sliced to point
full and wide outside off, pushed towards cover
nicely worked away to wide mid-on. Shortish and straight, wristy whip
short and wide, 120 kph, poor delivery, chopped to point

Kusal picks out the fielder this time and Sri Lanka have lost another. His terrible form continues. Short delivery outside off, Kusal goes back, looking to pull but the ball is too close to him. All he manages is a stabbed pull to mid-on. Sri Lanka under pressure
good length delivery around off, 122 kph, pushed to mid-on
short and wide outside off, 130 kph, Kusal looks to crash a cut through the off side but extra bounce takes it over the bat
full and straight around off, defended to mid-off
too straight and whipped away for four. Nicely played from Kusal. Waited for Jarvis to come to him and then hit the gap and the boundary
a slower ball on the pads, 110 kph, worked to deep midwicket for a single

125 kph, a big appeal, no says the umpire. But Zimbabwe review. They want Mathews. It seemed a tad high, full around off, the ball seams back in, hits Mathews high on the front pad in front of off. No bat on that. Missing the stumps says HawkEye, rising over. The review is lost
good length on middle and leg, 127 kph, picks out short fine leg with a nudge
a tad short and straight, swatted away through midwicket for a run to deep square leg
good length delivery outside off, pushed back to the bowler from the crease
shortish and still a tad wide outside off, 117 kph, pushed to mid-off
beauty! Goes fuller outside off, and then the ball moves away ever so late to beat the bat. Mathews actually quite lucky that moved considerably
full around off, worked into the midwicket region
129 kph, full around off, defended back
slower ball on middle and off, defended nicely
wow, how is that six? A low-flying six. Short and not that wide, he makes room and gets so much bottom hand power on his cut that it flies and flies and keeps flying over point. The shot of the day
shortish delivery on middle and leg, jammed away into the leg side.
129 kph, full on middle and leg, clipped down to short fine leg for a run. Opens his account
a slower delivery on middle, defended
short around off, swatted away to midwicket. 49 off 30 for Kusal Perera, not too many wild shots.
123 kph, on the pads, nudged to short fine leg
good length on middle and leg, some seam movement back in, worked away into the leg side
on the pads, flicked into the gap behind square for a couple. Kusal gets to fifty , a fine effort.
short delivery around off, shovelled to deep square leg
full delivery outside off, Mathews strides forward and defends to cover
full delivery outside off, 119 kph, hit back to the bowler. Mathews cautious early, as he should be
full delivery outside off, overpitched, drilled to mid-off
135 kph, full delivery outside off, right in the slot. Kusal swings and misses. He needn't be so aggressive
that's better, good cricket. Short and wide, dabbed down to third man. Ervine dives to his right and saves three. Fine stop
130 kph, seam movement, inward shape. On a length outside off, the ball comes back in, takes the inside edge onto the pad
short, the bouncer outside off, Mathews looks to drag the pull, makes no contact. Well bowled again
full delivery outside off, blocked to cover. A lot of shots for one run
124 kph, good length delivery around off, defended back
strays on the pads, nudged nicely to short fine leg
well played. On a length around off, 128 kph, nudged to midwicket for one
shortish delivery around off, dabbed towards gully for one. Nice batting from Kusal.
full and wide, Mathews' feet is rooted in the crease, driven to cover. He is careful of that seaming delivery back in
good length outside off, pushed towards wide mid-on. They aren't sure whether they want one, so Mathews decides against it
short and wide from Muzarabani, slashed to deep point for one.
good length around off, worked away to midwicket
big inside edge into the body. Ouch! Good length delivery outside off, Mathews plays outside the line and wears the blow.
a nice short delivery, around middle and leg, Mathews fails to connect. He is now 3 off 21 balls.
on the pads this time, and worked away past midwicket for a couple. Nicely played. He didn't force the pace
strays down leg this time, wide.
shortish delivery, dabbed away towards backward point. A quick run is easily made
on the pads, worked away into the gap behind square for a couple. Just placed.
good length around off, 121 kph, clipped to midwicket. Mathews has taken his time so far
full outside off, 128 kph, punched to cover from the crease
on the pads this time, 125 kph, Perera misses a flick, struck on the pad but the ball is sliding down leg
good length on middle and leg, nudged away to midwicket, a good tight run
short and wide outside off, 125 kph, carved straight to point
dropped! That flew again to deep backward point, who was placed right for that shot. Short and wide, slashed away in the air. The fielder comes in, but it's flat and quick to Mire. The ball pops out
shortish around middle and leg, worked down to fine leg. Mathews careful of not stepping on his stumps
full and wide outside off, Kusal doesn't move his feet, but goes through with a drive, beaten
better from Kusal. Responsible. Good length outside off, dabbed to deep point
a nice slower delivery outside off, driven neatly to deep cover for a single
another good single. Short around off, defended towards cover for a run. Well placed
a slower delivery outside off, pushed to mid-off. Early call of yes from Kusal, quality single
slower delivery down leg, wide
shortish delivery outside off, pulled through mid-on with decent timing. But he wanted it more towards midwicket
a slower delivery down leg, 121 kph, nudged to short fine leg
a good short ball around off, 124 kph, Mathews gets underneath the ball
another short delivery around off, 120 kph, pulled to deep square leg for a single. Got on top of the bounce
a slower ball on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
short ball outside off, rolls his wrists and controls a pull along the ground to deep square leg
fullish outside off, presses forward and drives it square of the wicket to deep point. The bowler has overstepped marginally
that's an unbelievable strike. Mathews maximises the free-hit. A full delivery, way outside off, fetches it from all the way there and slogs it clean and big over deep midwicket
was that deliberate? A length ball outside off. Yes, Mathews makes use of the vacant cordon and sticks the bat and slightly opens the face. A thick edge but intentional
length ball, tucked to midwicket fora quick single, beats the throw at the striker's end
short ball, outside off, jumps to get on top of the bounce and pats it through backward point for one
fullish, angles in from outside off, pushes to mid-on off the inside of the bat
full on off, driven off the front foot to long-on
full, slides on middle, defended off the inside of the bat
slightly back of a length, spins in, backs away and chops a cut into the surface as the ball keeps low
short of a length, no room, again chops a cut into the surface
similar length and now he finds the room he's looking for, cut through backward point
drifts into the pads and clips it as he's looking for a clip
spinning in from a length and kicking up, gets a glove to it as he tries to leave it
backs away but it spins in too sharply and he cannot free his arms on the cut to point
slides on with the arm, backs away and tries to cut but misses
length ball, spins into him and goes down the leg side
backs away and cuts this short of a length delivery through the covers. Superb timing and placement
advances down the ground and jabs this back to the bowler
length ball, leg side line, misses Mathews' flick and trickles to short fine leg off the pad
ripping length ball that turns away and bounces considerably to shoot past the outside edge
makes some room and forces a cut square of the wicket
length ball, spinning in outside off and keeping low, nudged away to deep backward square leg
short of a length, straightening around off, backs away and slaps to point
similar line and length, again cuts, this time to the left of deep point
back of a length, spinning in, punched to covers

misses everything. Perera blindly charges down the track and swings but the ball's too full and he can't get on top of it. It spins in sharply and gets well past the keeper. Not even half a chance at pulling off a stumping
fuller ball, inside-edges a flick
floated up outside off, drilled to midwicket
tries to make some room for a cut but just isn't finding it with the ball turning into him, pats it away to deep backward point
gives it too much air and sends down a low full toss that's shovelled to midwicket from one knee down
full on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
shot. Shovelled through midwicket. Back of a length, doesn't turn much, just slides into him and straightens around off. perera swings around and hammers a pull through deep midwicket
length ball on the stumps, punched down to long-on
slides it across Mathews' off-stump, he waits before opening the face to short third man
full outside off, driven down to long-on
full and accurate on middle, defended off the front foot
loopy and pushed across around middle, driven down to wide long-off
slid across around middle and off and spinning in, misses a flick and wears it on the pad
hangs back and pats it away to backward point. Again, gives him no room by spinning it into him
dropped. Perera was getting frustrated and charged down the track. Hammered a fuller ball straight back at Cremer. No reaction time. These need to stick on
full and accurate on the stumps, defended down the pitch
length ball, turns it around the corner with the spin
lands it at a slightly back of a length on middle and leg, punched down to long-on
length, slid across on middle and off, keeps a little low but he manages to stay in the crease and whip it to deep midwicket
full toss on middle and off, flicked down to long-on
fullish on middle and off, presses forward and nudges it into the leg side
advances slightly to meet the pitch and punches this down to long-on

nice, smart catch. Perera's been trying one shot too many and he finally loses his wicket. Tries to force a sweep and is really strangled for room as this one's slid into him and curves in sharply. And it's not full enough either which results in a top-edge that lobs towards short fine leg. Muzarabani moves across to his left and tumbles forward to take a nicely-judged catch
good length, spinning away outside off, presses forward and drops it into the off side

looped up on leg, drilled down to long-on where the fielder makes a save on the second attempt. Moves to his left and sticks the left hand out to flick it back even as the momentum carries him over the ropes
full on off, driven into the covers
looped up outside off and gets it to turn away, reaches out and drives it down to long-off
comes forward looking for a flick. This is the googly, spins into him and hits the pad. Would have gone down leg with the drift and turn
fuller outside off, pushed out into the off side on the front foot
short of a length outside off, drops into the covers and looks for a quick one but has to decide against it
full and angling into the pads, flicked off them to deep midwicket
short, outside off, slapped through the covers for one
back of a length, angling into his middle and leg, nudged towards the midwicket region
good length outside off, takes a good stride forward and punches solidly into the covers. The bowler has overstepped by a big margin. He bowled four of them in the last game
short of a length, Chandimal mistimes a pull and swings early as the ball takes the toe-end on its way to the keeper
full and sliding into his legs, tries to flick and gets hit on the pad
nicely tossed up outside off, driven with the spin to cover
slightly fuller and straighter, allows Mathews to drive with the spin to long-off
ooh beauty! Quick around off, the ball spins and beats the bat. Lots of turn
looking for the big reverse sweep, but can only top-edge it over the slip fielder for a run. That one dropped late
more flight outside off, driven away with the turn to cover
overpitched around off, drilled past the bowler for a couple to long-off.
short of a length, straightens from the fourth-stump channel and beats the outside edge
full and angling in on the pads, clipped out to mid-on
short of good length, flays a pull to midwicket where Raza makes a brilliant save diving to his left
gets some width outside off and he opens the face to run it down to third man
short, outside off, arches back and dabs it down to third man with a flat bat
short of a length outside off, gets on top of the bounce and taps it to backward point
reverse sweep. A pitched up legbreak outside off, Chandimal heaves it through the third man region with the turn. Brings up the 150 for his team
flighted on middle and leg, turns it away to midwicket
full, clipped off the pads through midwicket
full on the stumps again, drilled through midwicket again
short and wide outside off, slaps it out to deep point
loopy slider on middle and leg, comes forward and turns it away through the midwicket region. Good over for Sri Lanka. Four off the first ball followed by a single off each of the rest. More of that
sees a lot width outside off and opens up for a slap but finds extra cover
short of a length, angled in at middle from wide of the crease, flicked behind square on the leg side
fullish outside off, drops it into the covers from the crease
fuller length on off, defends in front of off towards mid-off
short of good length, gets on top of the bounce and gets a glove as he drops it into the surface

Raza takes a brilliant catch. Mathews doesn't get on top of this short ball and pulls without control. Hits it in the air and Raza from midwicket dives forward and takes a superb catch. Zimbabwe soaring
short and wide, slapped over the point fielder. Point jumps up with his left hand outstretched but the ball goes just over it
good length, angling in towards middle and off, flicked to midwicket
short of a length outside off, stands tall and punches solidly into the covers
cuts in from a short of a length ball, pushes it to point. Gunaratne sets off for a single and has to put in a dive to beat the throw
shortish, chest-height delivery. Chandimal swivels around and heaves a pull over deep square leg
short of a length outside off, punched to the right of sweeper cover and they come back for the second.Twelve off the over. They need a few more like this
slants this across around off and gets it to spin in, cut to backward point
good length, pitching outside leg and spinning further down that line
throws hard hands at a cut and gets a thick outside edge that flies to the left of short third man
stays back to a length ball and flicks through midwicket
short of a length, flat, punched down the ground to long-on
fullish, down the leg side, Gunaratne tries to flick and makes no contact as it's too full
clipped off the pads to short fine leg
fullish length, slid across on his pads, tucked through backward of square leg
a slower delivery outside off, carved away to point

ooh, it has clipped the off stump and Chandimal is bowled! Or is he? Chaos. It was a good length delivery that kept very low, Chandimal missed a clip, and the ball found a way between his bat and pad. The ball hit the off stump but the bail on middle and leg stump fell off. So that will be out. Tharanga's good luck, Chandimal's bad
a slower delivery on the pads, one leg bye down to fine leg
shortish delivery outside off, dabbed down to third man with the open face
off the bat, 126 kph, drifts down leg, Thisara gets just a bit of bat on his flick, the ball races past the keeper for four
short outside off, pulled into the gap at midwicket for a run
drifts down leg, nudged to short fine leg
short down leg, 93 kph, pulled away to deep backward square leg
short outside off, 89 kph, smashed to long-off from the back foot
overpitched outside off, skewed to midwicket from the crease
short down leg, sits up but Gunaratne misses a pull, struck on the pad, lobs up towards fine leg
full on middle and leg, defended to long-on. Goes past the bowler
short and wide outside off, carved away to deep cover point for a couple.
flight down leg, 84 kph, outside-halved towards third man
flight around middle and off, driven to cover

what a jaffa! Cremer strikes with an unplayable delivery. Tosses this up, draws Gunaratne forward, but the ball dips, drifts and spins past the outside edge. Gunaratne ran forward, hoping he could get to the pitch, but the ball beats him on the outside edge. The keeper does the rest. Lovely piece of legspin bowling
flight outside off, driven to long-off
off the inside edge to short leg. Flat on off, plays the line but there is some turn
flat outside off, turning in. Dabbed to short third man
short and wide outside off, carved away off the open face to deep point
short and quick on middle and leg, nudged away to deep midwicket
clipped down to short fine leg, one more
short around off, sits up for Perera to swat to long-on for one
quick around off, Hasaranga stays back and defends
edged, but no slip. Flat outside off, Thisara powers his hands through the line but the ball takes a thick edge and races away to the third man boundary
shortish and wide, outside off, turning in, dabbed to third man
the googly outside off, thick inside edge to short fine leg as he looked to drive
smashed for four. Sees flight, runs to the pitch and drills a drive right back at Cremer. No chance for the bowler with that power.
the googly on middle and leg, inside-edged towards midwicket
massive! More flight, another invitation for Thisara to run to the pitch, get there and loft a straight drive over long-off. Very big hit
quick delivery outside off, Hasaranga stays back and pushes to mid-off
short and wide outside off, Thisara goes back and slaps the ball at the bowler. Good stop
short and wide, worked away to long-on
comes down but Raza shortens the length, on middle and leg, spin takes the ball to the pad, and not bat
flat around middle and leg, worked away into the leg side
short down leg, pulled away to deep backward square leg
that's a big hit, and an important hit. Gets down to the pitch, and shovels a heave over midwicket for six. Just over the boundary

and holes out next ball. There is clever, thinking game awareness and then there is this shot. He has just hit a six, the asking rate is around six, but he still comes down and takes on Zimbabwe's best spinner, the legbreak outside off, chipped to long-off. He didn't get to the pitch either
the googly on off, defended into the point region
six more. This is getting interesting. More flight, a googly outside off. Thisara gets to the pitch and lofts the ball over long-off, hit with the full face
another thick edge through third man for four. Flat and wide outside off, he gets to the pitch, but jams it away off the outside edge
short and wide, dabbed to point. 17 runs and a wicket in that over
short outside off, Thisara goes back and clatters a pull to wide long-on
short and wide, 90 kph, cut to the sweeper cover
on the pads, 84 kph, worked against the spin to deep midwicket
flat outside off, slow, 83 kph, some turn takes the ball past the outside edge
and again, slower around off, draws Dananjaya forward but the ball beats the outside edge
shortish and wide, 86 kph, dabbed to point
shortish delivery on middle, worked away to deep square leg
a short delivery around middle and leg, Dananjaya ducks underneath
on the pads, worked to deep backward square leg
shortish outside off, 133 kph, slashed down to third man. One more. Sri Lanka need 50
well bowled, a bouncer on leg, the ball hits the glove and pops up
full delivery outside off, carved to point
flight outside off, 84 kph, sliced away towards point
strays down leg, wide
flight on middle and leg, driven to long-off
another nice drive with the spin to long-off
flat around off, punched to long-on from the back foot
flat on middle and leg, 74 kph, skids on with the arm, beats the inside edge and hits Dananjaya in front of leg, but sliding down
short and wide, slapped to cover from the back foot
into the gap and four. Short delivery on middle and leg, Thisara backs away and slaps the ball through midwicket
full and wide, 126 kph, carved away towards point for a run
a short delivery around off, nudged towards midwicket. Dananjaya sends Thisara back
good length outside off, carved away to point
a short delivery on middle, 130 kph, swatted away to deep square leg
nudged into the gap for a couple. That's Thisara's fifty, has put SL into a terrific position.
full and wide outside off, Dananjaya goes after it, a thick inside edge past the stumps for one to fine leg
strays down leg for a wide, 122 kph. Easy run
a nice yorker around off, jammed out to point
a slower delivery, wide, but inside the tramline, beats Dananjaya's wild swing
short and wide, slapped away to the sweeper cover for one
shortish around off, 119 kph, swatted away to deep midwicket
a short slower ball drifts down leg, another free run. Can't keep erring

juggled but taken at cover. A slower delivery outside off, the ball stops on Dananjaya, as he looks to drive over the infield. The ball lobs away towards cover, who backtracks and keeps his eyes on the ball. The ball pops out of Cremer's hands, but he takes the parry. But has he overstepped? Yikes, nothing behind the line, according to me. A no-ball for me. But he's been given. Hmm. Interesting.
full delivery outside off, 126 kph, inside-edged to fine leg. Just one
a short slower delivery on middle, worked away with soft hands to deep midwicket. A bad throw to the keeper
short delivery outside off, Thisara slaps the ball to mid-off for a run. Looking to go over mid-off
short delivery outside off, comes back in, dabbed to gully
a short slower delivery. Jarvis looking to elicit a pull, swatted to deep midwicket
a shortish slower delivery outside off, carved to point.
whee, in the wheelhouse and outta here. A slower ball on middle and leg, Thisara backs away and slogs the ball over midwicket. What power. A match-winning hit?
full on leg, pushed to long-on
a shortish delivery outside off, a thick outside edge down to third man. What was that? Gets away with it.

Thisara has holed out to deep midwicket! A massive moment in the game. A low full toss around off, Thisara clears his front leg and looks to heave the ball, but he toe-ends it away, without great timing. The ball is below the waist. Just met the ball a tad early.
full delivery outside off, driven to long-on
122 kph, a slower delivery outside off, driven to cover with the full face
thick outside edge off Cremer, full delivery outside off, the legbreak
flat and wide outside off, Cremer very cleverly shortens the length, dabbed, or at least tries to dab the ball, misses
short and wide outside off, the googly, pulled back to the bowler. Pressure
82 kph, a low full toss down leg, worked away to long-on. 14 required.
the googly. Cremer is ensuring the ball isn't full, so that batsmen can't get underneath that. On off, defended
87 kph, full on middle and leg, driven to long-on

and Zimbabwe take the game! A slower short delivery outside off, Chameera is completely deceived by the lack of pace, meets the ball too early and the ball lobs to point. Sensational game goes to Cremer and Zimbabwe. It was a clever change in pace, with the batsmen expecting the ball full and straight, but it was an offcutter that flummoxed Chameera, forcing him to make contact much earlier than he expected. Sri Lanka's dismal ODI record in the last few months continues.
